name: GetTimePeriods
description:
Retrieve compact time period records from Asana.

Use this tool to access and retrieve compact time period records from Asana's service when you need to handle or analyze time-related data.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the Asana workspace.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page, from 1 to 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination. Use the offset from a previous API response to retrieve the next page of results. If omitted, the first page is returned.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for the time period in ISO 8601 format. Determines the beginning of the time period records to be retrieved.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date for time periods in ISO 8601 format. Specify the last date to include in the returned results.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: A list of optional property names to include in the response, specified as an array of strings.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to receive formatted, readable output mainly for debugging, increasing response size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace.
